translation: The faults of nobly-born are seen Like on the sky the spots of moon
explanation: As spots on her bright orb that walks sublime the evening sky
mk: பிறந்த குடிக்குப் பெருமை சேர்ப்பவரிடமுள்ள சிறிய குறைகள், ஒளிவு மறைவு ஏதுமின்றி, வானத்து நிலவில் உள்ள குறைபோல வெளிப்படையாகத் தெரியக் கூடியதாகும்
mv: உயர் குடியில் பிறந்தவரிடத்தில் உண்டாகும் குற்றம், ஆகாயத்தில் திங்களிடம் காணப்படும் களங்கம்போல் பலரறியத் தோன்றும்.
sp: நல்ல குடும்பத்தில் பிறந்தவரிடம் ஏதேனும் குறை இருந்தால் அது நிலாவில் தெரியும் களங்கம் போல் பெரிதாகத் தெரியும்.
gptExplanation:
Kural 957 delves into the concept of individual honor and reputation, especially in the context of those born into esteemed families or clans. It draws a parallel between personal flaws and the spots on the moon, a celestial body known for its radiant glow in the evening sky.

The verse suggests that any minor shortcomings or faults in a person who is born into a respectable family are clearly visible, similar to how the spots on the moon are prominent against its luminous background. These faults stand out more prominently because they are in stark contrast to the high standards and expectations associated with their family lineage.

Just as the spots on the moon do not diminish its overall brilliance, these minor flaws do not necessarily mar the individual's entire character or reputation. However, they are more noticeable due to the high regard and respect that their family holds in society. The kural essentially underlines the importance of living up to one's familial or societal expectations and maintaining one's honor and reputation by avoiding any misconduct or dishonorable behavior that may tarnish it.
